actions.name: Abort
actions.description: Stops execution of the action list.

actions.name: Abort If
actions.description: Stops execution of the action list if this action's condition evaluates to true. If it does not, execution continues with the next action.

args.name: Condition
args.description: Specifies whether the execution is stopped.

actions.name: Abort If Condition Is False
actions.description: Stops execution of the action list if at least one condition in the condition list is false. If all conditions are true, execution continues with the next action.

actions.name: Abort If Condition Is True
actions.description: Stops execution of the action list if all conditions in the condition list are true. If any are false, execution continues with the next action.

actions.name: Allow Button
actions.description: Undoes the effect of the disallow button action for one or more players.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players whose button is being reenabled.

args.name: Button
args.description: The logical button that is being reenabled.

actions.name: Apply Impulse
actions.description: Applies an instantaneous change in velocity to the movement of one or more players.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players whose velocity will be changed.

args.name: Direction
args.description: The unit direction in which the impulse will be applied. This value is normalized internally.

args.name: Speed
args.description: The magnitude of the change to the velocities of the player or players.

args.name: Relative
args.description: Specifies whether direction is relative to world coordinates or the local coordinates of the player or players.

args.name: Motion
args.description: Specifies whether direction is relative to world coordinates or the local coordinates of the player or players.

actions.name: Big Message
actions.description: Displays a large message above the reticle that is visible to specific players.

args.name: Visible To
args.description: One or more players who will see the message.

args.name: Header
args.description: The message to be displayed.

actions.name: Chase Global Variable At Rate
actions.description: Gradually modifies the value of a global variable at a specific rate. Global variable is a variable that belongs to the game itself.)

args.name: Variable
args.description: Specifies which global variable to modify gradually.

args.name: Destination
args.description: The value that the global variable will eventually reach. The type of this value may be either a number or a vector. Though the variable's existing value must be of the same type before the chase begins.

args.name: Rate
args.description: The amount of change that will happen to the variable's value each second.

args.name: Reevaluation
args.description: Specifies which of this action's inputs will be continuously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

actions.name: Chase Global Variable Over Time
actions.description: Gradually modifies the value of a global variable over time. (a global variable is a variable that belongs to the game itself.)

args.name: Variable
args.description: Specifies which global variable to modify gradually.

args.name: Destination
args.description: The value that the global variable will eventually reach. The type of this value may be either a number or a vector. Though the variable's existing value must be of the same type before the chase begins.

args.name: Duration
args.description: The amount of time, in seconds, over which the variable's value will approach the destination.

args.name: Reevaluation
args.description: Specifies which of this action's inputs will be continuously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

actions.name: Chase Player Variable At Rate
actions.description: Gradually modifies the value of a player variable at a specific rate. (a player variable is a variable that belongs to a specific player.)

args.name: Player
args.description: The player whose variable will gradually change. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will change independently.

args.name: Variable
args.description: Specifies which of the player's variables to modify gradually.

args.name: Destination
args.description: The value that the player variable will eventually reach. The type of this value may be either a number or a vector. Though the variable's existing value must be of the same type before the chase begins.

args.name: Rate
args.description: The amount of change that will happen to the variable's value each second.

actions.name: Chase Player Variable Over Time
actions.description: Gradually modifies the value of a player variable over time. (a player variable is a variable that belongs to a specific player.)

args.name: Player
args.description: The player whose variable will gradually change. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will change independently.

args.name: Variable
args.description: Specifies which of the player's variables to modify gradually.

args.name: Destination
args.description: The value that the player variable will eventually reach. The type of this value may be either a number or a vector. Though the variable's existing value must be of the same type before the chase begins.

args.name: Duration
args.description: The amount of time, in seconds, over which the variable's value will approach the destination.

actions.name: Clear Status
actions.description: Clears a status that was applied from a set status action from one or more players.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players from whom the status will be removed.

args.name: Status
args.description: The status to be removed from the player or players.

actions.name: Communicate
actions.description: Causes one or more players to use an emote, voice line, or other equipped communication.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players to perform the communication.

args.name: Type
args.description: The type of communication.

actions.name: Create Effect
actions.description: Creates an in-world effect entity. This effect entity will persist until destroyed. To obtain a reference to this entity, use the last created entity value. This action will fail if too many entities have been created.

args.name: Visible To
args.description: One or more players who will be able to see the effect.

args.name: Type
args.description: The type of effect to be created.

args.name: Color
args.description: The color of the effect to be created. If a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue. Depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer. Does not apply to sound effects.

args.name: Position
args.description: The effect's position. If this value is a player, then the effect will move along with the player. Otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world.

args.name: Radius
args.description: The radius of this effect.

args.name: Reevaluation
args.description: Specifies which of this action's inputs will be continuously reevaluated.

actions.name: Create Hud Text
actions.description: Reates hud text visible to specific players at a specific location on screen. This text will persist until destroyed. To obtain a eference to this text, use the last text id value. This action will fail if do many text elements have been created.

args.name: Visible To
args.description: One or more players who will see the hud text.

args.name: Header
args.description: The text to be displayed (can be blank)

args.name: Subheader
args.description: The subheader text to be displayed (can be blank)

args.name: Text
args.description: The body text to be displayed (can be blank)

args.name: Location
args.description: The location on the screen where the text will appear.

args.name: Sort Order
args.description: The sort order of the text relative to other text in the same location. A higher sort order will come after a lower sort order.

args.name: Header Color
args.description: The color of the header.

args.name: Subheader Color
args.description: The color of the subheader.

args.name: Text Color
args.description: The color of the text.

args.name: Reevaluation
args.description: Specifies which of this action's inputs will be continuously reevaluated.

actions.name: Create Icon
actions.description: Creates an in-world icon entity. This icon entity will persist until destroyed. To obtain a reference to this entity, use the last created entity value. This action will fail if too many entities have been created.

args.name: Visible To
args.description: One or more players who will be able to see the icon.

args.name: Position
args.description: The icon's position. If this value is a player, then the icon will appear above the player's head. Otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world.

args.name: Icon
args.description: The icon to be created.

args.name: Reevaluation
args.description: Specifies which of this action's inputs will be continuously reevaluated. The icon will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

args.name: Show When Offscreen
args.description: Should this icon appear even when it is behind you?

actions.name: Create In-World Text
actions.description: Creates in-world text visible to specific players at a specific position the world. This text will persist until destroyed. To obtain a eference to this text, use the last text id value. This action will fail if do many text elements have been created.

args.name: Visible To
args.description: One or more players who will see the in-world text.

args.name: Header
args.description: The text to be displayed.

args.name: Position
args.description: The texts position. If this value is a player, then the text will appear above the player's head. Otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world.

args.name: Scale
args.description: The texts scale.

args.name: Clipping
args.description: Specifies whether the text can be seen through walls or is instead clipped.

args.name: Reevaluation
args.description: Specifies which of this action's inputs will be continuously reevaluated. The text will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

actions.name: Damage
actions.description: Applies instantaneous damage to one or more players, possibly killing the players.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players who will receive damage.

args.name: Damager
args.description: The player who will receive credit for the damage. A damager of null indicates no player will receive credit.

args.name: Amount
args.description: The amount of damage to apply. This amount may be modified by buffs, debuffs. Or armor.

actions.name: Declare Match Draw
actions.description: Qstantly ends the match in a draw. This action has no effect in free- or-all modes.

actions.name: Declare Player Victory
actions.description: Instantly ends the match with the specific player as the winner. This action only has an effect in free-for-all modes.

args.name: Player
args.description: The winning player.

actions.name: Declare Round Victory
actions.description: Declare a team as the current round winner. This only works in the ontrol and elimination game modes

args.name: Round Winning Team
args.description: Round winning team

actions.name: Declare Team Victory
actions.description: Instantly ends the match with the specified team as the winner. This action has no effect in free-for-all modes.

args.name: Team
args.description: The winning team.

actions.name: Destroy All Effects
actions.description: Destroys all effect entities created by create effect.

actions.name: Destroy All Hud Text
actions.description: Destroys all hud text that was created by the create hud text action.

actions.name: Destroy All Icons
actions.description: Destroys all icon entities created by create icon.

actions.name: Destroy All In-World Text
actions.description: Destroys all in-world text created by create in-world text.

actions.name: Destroy Effect
actions.description: Destroys an effect entity that was created by create effect.

args.name: Entity
args.description: Specifies which effect entity to destroy. This entity may be last created entity or a variable into which last created entity was earlier stored.

actions.name: Destroy Hud Text
actions.description: Destroys hud text that was created by create hud text.

args.name: Text Id
args.description: Specifies which hud text to destroy. This id may be last text id or a variable into which last text id was earlier stored.

actions.name: Destroy Icon
actions.description: Destroys an icon entity that was created by create icon.

args.name: Entity
args.description: Specifies which icon entity to destroy. This entity may be last created entity or a variable into which last created entity was earlier stored.

actions.name: Destroy In-World Text
actions.description: Destroys in-world text that was created by create in-world text.

args.name: Text Id
args.description: Specifies which in-world text to destroy. This id may be last text id or a variable into which last text id was earlier stored.

actions.name: Disable Built-In Game Mode Announcer
actions.description: Disables game mode announcements from the announcer until reenabled or the match ends.

actions.name: Disable Built-In Game Mode Completion
actions.description: Disables completion of the match from the game mode itself, only allowing the match to be completed by scripting commands.

actions.name: Disable Built-In Game Mode Music
actions.description: Disables all game mode music until reenabled or the match ends.

actions.name: Disable Built-In Game Mode Respawning
actions.description: Disables automatic respawning for one or more players, only allowing respawning by scripting commands.

args.name: Players
args.description: The player or players whose respawning is affected.

actions.name: Disable Built-In Game Mode Scoring
actions.description: Disables changes to player and team scores from the game mode itself, only allowing scores to be changed by scripting commands.

args.name: Player

actions.description: Undoes the effect of the enable death spectate target hud action for or more players.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players who will revert to seeing their own hud while death spectating.

actions.description: Disables a logical button for one or more players such that pressing it has no effect.

args.description: The player or players who will be allowed to spectate all players.

actions.description: 'auses one or more players to see their spectate target's hud instead their own while death spectating.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players who will begin seeing their spectate targets hud while death spectating.

actions.name: Go To Assemble Heroes
actions.description: Returns the match to the assemble heroes phase of the game mode. Only works if the game is in progress.

args.description: The player who will receive credit for the healing. A healer of null indicates no player will receive credit.

args.description: The amount of healing to apply. This amount may be modified by bufi or debuffs. Healing is capped by each player's max health.

actions.description: Instantly kills one or more players.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players who will be killed.

args.name: Killer
args.description: The player who will receive credit for the kill. A killer of null indicates no player will receive credit.

actions.name: Loop
actions.description: Restarts the action list from the beginning. To prevent an infinite .oop, a wait action must execute between the start of the action list this action.

actions.name: Loop If
actions.description: Restarts the action list from the beginning if this action's condition valuates to true. If it does not, execution continues with the next ction. To prevent an infinite loop, a wait action must execute etween the start of the action list and this action.

args.name: Condition
args.description: Specifies whether the loop will occur.

actions.description: Restarts the action list from the beginning if at least one condition the condition list is false. If all conditions are true, execution

actions.name: Loop If Condition Is True
actions.description: Restarts the action list from the beginning if every condition in the condition list is true. If any are false, execution continues with the next action. To prevent an infinite loop, a wait action must execute between the start of the action list and this action.

actions.name: Set Respawn Max Time
actions.description: Sets the duration between death and respawn for one or more players. For players that are already dead when this action is executed, the change takes effect on their next death.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players whose respawn max time is being defined.

args.name: Time
args.description: The duration between death and respawn in seconds.

actions.name: Set Secondary Fire Enabled
actions.description: Enables or disables secondary fire for one or more players.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players whose access to secondary fire is affected.

args.name: Enabled
args.description: Specifies whether the player or players are able to use secondary fire. Expects a boolean value such as true, false. Or compare.

actions.name: Set Secondary Fire Enabled
actions.description: Enables or disables secondary fire for one or more players.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players whose access to secondary fire is affected.

args.name: Enabled
args.description: Specifies whether the player or players are able to use secondary fire. Expects a boolean value such as true, false. Or compare.

actions.name: Set Slow Motion
actions.description: Sets the simulation rate for the entire game, including all players, projectiles, effects, and game mode logic.

args.name: Speed Percent
args.description: The simulation rate as a percentage of normal speed. Only rates up to 100% are allowed.

actions.name: Set Status
actions.description: Applies a status to one or more players. This status will remain in effect for the specified duration or until it is cleared by the clear status action.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players to whom the status will be applied.

args.name: Assister
args.description: Specifies a player to be awarded assist credit should the affected player or players be killed while the status is in effect. An assister of null indicates no player will receive credit.

args.name: Status
args.description: The status to be applied to the player or players. These behave similarly to statuses applied from hero abilities.

args.name: Duration
args.description: The duration of the status in seconds. To have a status that lasts until a clear status action is executed. Provide an arbitrarily long duration such as 9999.

actions.name: Set Team Score
actions.description: Sets the score for one or both teams. This action has no effect in free-for-all modes or modes without a team score.

args.name: Team
args.description: The team or teams whose score will be set.

args.name: Score
args.description: The score that will be set.

actions.name: Set Ultimate Ability Enabled
actions.description: Enables or disables the ultimate ability of one or more players.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players whose access to their ultimate ability is affected.

args.name: Enabled
args.description: Specifies whether the player or players are able to use their ultimate ability. Expects a boolean value such as true. False, or compare.

actions.name: Set Ultimate Charge
actions.description: Sets the ultimate charge for one or more players as a percentage of iaximum charge.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players whose ultimate charge will be set.

args.name: Charge Percent
args.description: The percentage of maximum charge.

actions.name: Skip
actions.description: Skips execution of a certain number of actions in the action list.

args.name: Number Of Actions
args.description: The number of actions to skip, not including this action.

actions.name: Skip If
actions.description: Skips execution of a certain number of actions in the action list if this action's condition evaluates to true. If it does not, execution continues with the next action.

args.name: Condition
args.description: Specifies whether the skip occurs.

args.name: Number Of Actions
args.description: The number of actions to skip, not including this action.

actions.name: Small Message
actions.description: Displays a small message beneath the reticle that is visible to specific players.

args.name: Visible To
args.description: One or more players who will see the message.

args.name: Header
args.description: The message to be displayed.

actions.name: Start Accelerating
actions.description: Starts accelerating one or more players in a specified direction.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players that will begin accelerating.

args.name: Direction
args.description: The unit direction in which the acceleration will be applied. This value is normalized internally.

args.name: Rate
args.description: The rate of acceleration in meters per second squared. This value may need to be quite high in order to overcome gravity and/or surface friction.

args.name: Max Speed
args.description: The speed at which acceleration will stop for the player or players. It may not be possible to reach this speed due to gravity and/or surface friction.

actions.name: Start Camera
actions.description: Places your camera at a location, facing a direction.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players whose cameras will be placed at the location.

args.name: Eye Position
args.description: The position of the camera. Reevaluates continuously.

args.name: Look At Position
args.description: Where the camera looks at. Reevaluates continuously.

args.name: Blend Speed
args.description: How fast to blend the camera speed as positions change. 0 means do not blend at all, and just change positions instantly.

actions.name: Start Damage Modification
actions.description: Starts modifying how much damage one or more receivers will receive from one or more damagers. A reference to this damage aodification can be obtained from the last damage modification id value. This action will fail if too many damage modifications have been started.

args.name: Receivers
args.description: The player or players whose incoming damage will be modified (when attacked by the damagers).

args.name: Damagers
args.description: The player or players whose outgoing damage will be modified (when attacking the receivers).

args.name: Damage Percent
args.description: The percentage of damage that will apply to receivers when attacked by damagers.

args.name: Reevaluation
args.description: Specifies which of this action's inputs will be continuously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

actions.name: Start Damage Over Time
actions.description: Starts an instance of damage over time. This dot will persist for the specified duration or until stopped by script. To obtain a reference ro this dot, use the last damage over time id value.

args.name: Player
args.description: One or more players who will receive the damage over time.

args.name: Damager
args.description: The player who will receive credit for the damage. A damager of null indicates no player will receive credit.

args.name: Duration
args.description: The duration of the damage over time in seconds. To have a dot thai lasts until stopped by script, provide an arbitrarily long duration such as 9999.

args.name: Damage Per Second
args.description: The damage per second for the damage over time.

actions.name: Start Facing
actions.description: Starts turning one or more players to face the specified direction.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players who will start iurning.

args.name: Direction
args.description: The unit direction in which the player or players will eventually face. This value is normalized internally.

args.name: Turn Rate
args.description: The turn rate in degrees per second.

args.name: Relative
args.description: Specifies whether direction is relative to world coordinates or the local coordinates of the player or players.

actions.name: Start Forcing Player To Be Hero
actions.description: Starts forcing one or more players to be a specific hero and, if necessary, respawns them immediately in their current location. This will be the only hero available to the player or players until the top forcing player to be hero action is executed.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players who will be forced to be a specific hero.

args.name: Hero
args.description: The hero that the player or players will be forced to be.

actions.name: Start Forcing Spawn Room
actions.description: Forces a team to spawn in a particular spawn room, regardless of the spawn room normally used by the game mode. This action only has an effect in assault, hybrid, and payload maps.

args.name: Team
args.description: The team whose spawn room will be forced.

args.name: Room
args.description: The number of the spawn room to be forced. O is the first spawn room, 1 the second. And 2 is the third. If the specified spawn room does not exist, players will use the normal spawn room.

actions.name: Start Forcing Throttle
actions.description: Defines minimum and maximum movement input values for one or more players, possibly forcing or preventing movement.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players whose movement will be forced or limited.

args.name: Min Forward
args.description: Sets the minimum run forward amount. 0 allows the player or players to stop while 1 forces full forward movement.

args.name: Max Forward
args.description: Sets the maximum run forward amount. 0 prevents the player or players from moving forward while 1 allows full forward movement.

args.name: Min Backward
args.description: Sets the minimum run backward amount. 0 allows the player or players to stop while 1 forces full backward movement.

args.name: Max Backward
args.description: Sets the maximum run backward amount. 0 prevents the player or players from moving backward while 1 allows full backward movement.

args.name: Min Sideways
args.description: Sets the minimum run sideways amount. 0 allows the player or players to stop while 1 forces full sideways movement.

args.name: Max Sideways
args.description: Sets the maximum run sideways amount. 0 prevents the player or players from moving Sideways while 1 allows full sideways movement.

actions.name: Start Heal Over Time
actions.description: Starts an instance of heal over time. This hot will persist for the specified duration or until stopped by script. To obtain a reference to this hot, use the last heal over time id value.

args.name: Player
args.description: One or more players who will receive the heal over time.

args.name: Healer
args.description: The player who will receive credit for the healing. A healer of null indicates no player will receive credit.

args.name: Duration
args.description: The duration of the heal over time in seconds. To have a hot that lasts until stopped by script, provide an arbitrarily long duration such as 9999.

args.name: Healing Per Second
args.description: The healing per second for the heal over time.

actions.name: Start Holding Button
actions.description: Forces one or more players to hold a button virtually until stopped by the stop holding button action.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players who are holding a button virtually.

args.name: Button
args.description: The logical button that is being held virtually.

actions.name: Stop Accelerating
actions.description: Stops the acceleration started by the start accelerating action for one or more players.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players who will stop accelerating.

actions.name: Stop All Damage Modifications
actions.description: Stops all damage modifications that were started using the start damage modification action.

actions.name: Stop All Damage Over Time
actions.description: Stops all damage over time started by start damage over time for one or more players.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players whose scripted damage over time will stop.

actions.name: Stop All Heal Over Time
actions.description: Stops all heal over time started by start heal over time for one or more players.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players whose scripted heal over time will stop.

actions.name: Stop Camera
actions.description: None

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players whose cameras will be put back to the default view.

actions.name: Stop Chasing Global Variable
actions.description: Stops an in-progress chase of a global variable, leaving it at its current value.

args.name: Variable
args.description: Specifies which global variable to stop modifying.

actions.name: Stop Chasing Player Variable
actions.description: Stops an in-progress chase of a player variable, leaving it at its current value.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player whose variable will stop changing. If multiple players ari provided, each of their variables will stop changing.

args.name: Variable
args.description: Specifies which of the player's variables to stop modifying.

actions.name: Stop Damage Modification
actions.description: Stops a damage modification that was started by the start damage modification action.

args.name: Damage Modification
args.description: Specifies which damage modification instance to stop. This id may be last damage modification id or a variable into which last damage modification id was earlier stored.

actions.name: Stop Damage Over Time
actions.description: Stops an instance of damage over time started by the start damage over time action.

args.name: Damage Over Time Id
args.description: Specifies which damage over time instance to stop. This id may be lasi damage over time id or a variable into which last damage over time id was earlier stored.

actions.name: Stop Facing
actions.description: Stops the turning started by the start facing action for one or more players.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players who will stop wrning.

actions.name: Stop Forcing Player To Be Hero
actions.description: - stops forcing one or more players to be a specific hero. This will not respawn the player or players, but it will restore their hero availability the next time they go to select a hero.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players who will no longer be forced to be a specific hero.

actions.name: Stop Forcing Spawn Room
actions.description: Undoes the effect of the start forcing spawn room action for the specified team.

args.name: Team
args.description: The team that will resume using their normal spawn room.

actions.name: Stop Forcing Throttle
actions.description: Undoes the effect of the start forcing throttle action for one or more players.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players whose movement input will be restored.

actions.name: Stop Heal Over Time
actions.description: Stops an instance of heal over time started by the start heal over time action.

args.name: Heal Over Time Id
args.description: Specifies which heal over time instance to stop. This id may be last heal over time id or a variable into which last heal over time id was earlier stored.

actions.name: Stop Holding Button
actions.description: Undoes the effect of the start holding button action for one or more players.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players who are no longer holding a button virtually.

args.name: Button
args.description: The logical button that is no longer being held virtually.

actions.name: Teleport
actions.description: Teleports one or more players to the specified position.

args.name: Player
args.description: The player or players to teleport.

args.name: Position
args.description: The position to which the player or players will teleport. If a player is provided, the position of the player is used.

actions.name: Unpause Match Time
actions.description: Unpauses the match time.

actions.name: Wait
actions.description: Pauses the execution of the action list. Unless the wait is interrupted, he remainder of the actions will execute after the pause.

args.name: Time
args.description: The duration of the pause.

args.name: Wait Behavior
args.description: Specifies if and how the wait can be interrupted. If the condition list is ignored. The wait will not be interrupted. Otherwise. The condition list will determine if and when the action list will abort or restart.

values.name: Absolute Value
values.description: The absolute value of the specified value.

args.name: Value
args.description: The real number value whose absolute value will be computed.

values.name: Add
values.description: The sum of two numbers or vectors.

args.name: Value
args.description: The left-hand operand. May be any value that results in a number or a vector.

args.name: Value
args.description: The right-hand operand. May be any value that results in a number or a vector.

values.name: All Dead Players
values.description: An array containing all dead players on a team or in the match.

args.name: Team
args.description: The team or teams from which players may come.

values.name: All Heroes
values.description: The array of all heroes in overwatch.

values.name: All Living Players
values.description: An array containing all living players on a team or in the match.

args.name: Team

args.name: Team
args.description: The team or teams from which players may come.

values.name: All Players Not On Objective

args.name: Team

values.name: All Players On Objective
values.description: An array containing all players occupying a payload or control point (either on a team or in the match).

args.name: Team
args.description: The team or teams from which players may come.

values.name: Allowed Heroes
values.description: The array of heroes from which the specified player is currently allowed to select.

args.name: Player

values.name: Altitude Of
values.description: The player's current height in meters above a surface. Results in o whenever the player is on a surface.

args.name: Player

values.name: And
values.description: Whether both of the two inputs are true (or equivalent to true).

args.name: Value
args.description: One of the two inputs considered. If both are true (or equivalent to true), then the and value is true.

args.name: Value
args.description: One of the two inputs considered. If both are true (or equivalent to true), then the and value is true.

values.name: Angle Difference
values.description: The difference in degrees between two angles. After the angles are wrapped to be within +/- 180 of each other, the result is positive if the second angle is greater than the first angle. Otherwise, the result is zero or negative.

args.name: Angle
args.description: One of the two angles between which to measure the resulting anole.

args.name: Angle
args.description: One of the two angles between which to measure the resulting anole.

values.name: Append To Array
values.description: A copy of an array with one or more values appended to the end.

args.name: Array
args.description: The array to which to append.

args.name: Value
args.description: The value to append to the end of the array. If this value is itself an array. Each element is appended.

values.name: Array Slice
values.description: A copy of the specified array containing only values from a specified index range.

args.name: Array
args.description: The array from which to make a copy.

args.name: Start Index
args.description: The first index of the range.

args.name: Count
args.description: The number of elements in the resulting array. The resulting array wu contain fewer elements if the specified range exceeds the bounds of the array.

values.name: Attacker
values.description: The player that dealt the damage for the event currently being processed by this rule. May be the same as the victim or the event player.

values.name: Backward
values.description: Shorthand for the directional vector(0, 0, -1), which points backward.

values.name: Closest Player To
values.description: The player closest to a position, optionally restricted by team.

args.name: Center
args.description: The position from which to measure proximity.

args.name: Team
args.description: The team or teams from which the closest player will come.

values.name: Compare
values.description: Whether the comparison of the two inputs is true.

args.name: Value
args.description: The left-hand side of the comparison. This may be any value type if the operation is == or !=. Otherwise, real numbers are expected.

args.name: Value
args.description: The right-hand side of the comparison. This may be any value type if the operation is == or !=. Otherwise, real numbers are expected.

values.name: Control Mode Scoring Percentage
values.description: The score percentage for the specified team in control mode.

args.name: Team
args.description: The team whose score percentage to acquire.

values.name: Control Mode Scoring Team
values.description: The team that is currently accumulating score percentage in control mode. Results in all if neither team is accumulating score.

values.name: Cosine From Degrees
values.description: Cosine of the specified angle in degrees.

args.name: Angle
args.description: Angle in degrees.

values.name: Cosine From Radians
values.description: Cosine of the specified angle in radians.

args.name: Angle
args.description: Angle in radians.

values.name: Count Of
values.description: The number of elements in the specified array.

args.name: Array
args.description: The array whose elements will be counted.

values.name: Cross Product
values.description: The cross product of the specified values. (left cross up equals forward.)

args.name: Value

args.name: Value
args.description: The right-hand-side vector operand of the cross product.

values.name: Current Array Element
values.description: The current array element being considered. Only meaningful during the evaluation of values such as filtered array and sorted array.

values.name: Direction From Angles
values.description: The unit-length direction vector corresponding to the specified angles.

args.name: Horizontal Angle
args.description: The horizontal angle in degrees used to construct the resulting vector.

args.name: Vertical Angle
args.description: The vertical angle in degrees used to construct the resulting vector.

values.name: Direction Towards
values.description: The unit-length direction vector from one position to another.

args.name: Start Pos

args.name: End Pos
args.description: The position to which the resulting direction vector will point.

values.name: Distance Between
values.description: The distance between two positions in meters.

args.name: Start Pos
args.description: One of the two positions used in the distance measurement.

args.name: End Pos
args.description: One of the two positions used in the distance measurement.

values.description: The ratio of two numbers or vectors. A vector divided by a number will yield a scaled vector. Division by zero results in zero.

args.name: Value
args.description: The right-hand operand. May be any value that results in a number or a vector.

values.name: Dot Product
values.description: The dot product of the specified values.

values.name: Empty Array

values.description: Whether the specified player, icon entity, or effect entity still exists. Useful for determining if a player has left the match or an entity has been destroyed.

args.name: Entity
args.description: The player, icon entity, or effect entity whose existence to check.

values.name: Event Damage
values.description: The amount of damage received by the victim for the event currently being processed by this rule.

values.name: Event Player
values.description: The player executing this rule, as specified by the event. May be the same as the attacker or victim.

values.name: Event Was Critical Hit
values.description: Whether the damage was a critical hit (such as a headshot) for the event currently being processed by this rule.

values.name: Eye Position
values.description: The position of a player's first person view (used for aiming)

args.name: Player
args.description: The position of a player's first person view (used for aiming)

values.name: Facing Direction Of

values.name: False

values.name: Farthest Player From
values.description: The player farthest from a position, optionally restricted by team.

args.name: Team

args.name: Condition
